greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into proper divisors of n, cf. A027751.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (terms n = 0..197 from Reinhard Zumkeller)
maple: a:= proc(n) local b, l; l:= sort([(divisors(n) minus {n})[]]):
b:= proc(m, i) option remember; `if`(m=0 or i=1, 1,
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{b, l}, l = Most[Divisors[n]]; b[m_, i_] := b[m, i] = If[m==0 || i==1, 1, If[i<1, 0, b[m, i-1] + If[l[[i]]>m, 0, b[m-l[[i]], i]]]]; b[n, Length[l]]]; a[0]=1; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 02 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: a210442 n = p (a027751_row n) n where
p ks'@(k:ks) m = if m < k then 0 else p ks' (m - k) + p ks m
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 21 2013
